solution_line_template: An eagle can fly {eagle_speed} x {flight_duration} = <<{eagle_speed}*{flight_duration}={eagle_distance}>>{eagle_distance} miles for {flight_duration} hours.
A falcon can fly {falcon_speed} x {flight_duration} = <<{falcon_speed}*{flight_duration}={falcon_distance}>>{falcon_distance} miles for {flight_duration} hours.
A pelican can fly {pelican_speed} x {flight_duration} = <<{pelican_speed}*{flight_duration}={pelican_distance}>>{pelican_distance} miles for {flight_duration} hours.
A hummingbird can fly {hummingbird_speed} x {flight_duration} = <<{hummingbird_speed}*{flight_duration}={hummingbird_distance}>>{hummingbird_distance} miles for {flight_duration} hours.

Therefore, the birds flew a total of {eagle_distance} + {falcon_distance} + {pelican_distance} + {hummingbird_distance} = <<{eagle_distance}+{falcon_distance}+{pelican_distance}+{hummingbird_distance}={total_miles}>>{total_miles} miles for {flight_duration} hours.
